hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Ubaidah: Do not make books incumbent upon me.

narrators.name: Hisham
narrators.full_name: Hisham ibn Abd al-Malik al-Qurashi Abu al-Walid

narrators.name: Amr ibn al-Haytham
narrators.full_name: Amr ibn al-Haytham Abu Qatan al-Qattan

narrators.name: Shu'bah
narrators.full_name: Shu'bah ibn al-Hajjaj ibn al-Ward al-Ataki

narrators.name: al-Hakam
narrators.full_name: al-Hakam ibn Aban ibn Uthman al-Umawi

chainIssues: al-Hakam ibn Aban is a weak/saduq narrator and uses indirect transmission term (عَنِ) from Ibrahim
Multiple intermediaries between al-Hakam and Ubaidah with use of indirect transmission terms

potential_issues.issue: al-Hakam ibn Aban is graded as Saduq (weak), not of the highest reliability level
potential_issues.impact: The presence of a Saduq narrator in the chain affects the overall reliability, downgrading from Perfect/Sound to Acceptable category

potential_issues.issue: Indirect transmission terms (عَنْ/عَنِ) used in connection with less-reliable narrators
potential_issues.impact: Creates ambiguity about the strength of connection between narrators in this portion of the chain

Topics: Ubaidah's instruction regarding abandonment of written books

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by al-Nu'man ibn Qais: Ubaidah called for his books at the time of death, erased them, and said: I fear that someone after me will take charge of them and place them in a wrong place.

chainIssues: Good chain with reliable narrators, uses direct transmission terms (أَخْبَرَنَا/حَدَّثَنَا)
Only al-Nu'man ibn Qais uses indirect transmission term (عَنْ) but he is a reliable narrator

potential_issues.issue: al-Nu'man ibn Qais uses indirect transmission (عَنْ) from Ubaidah
potential_issues.impact: Introduces slight ambiguity about directness of the connection, but al-Nu'man is reliable and likely met Ubaidah, so this does not significantly affect the chain

Topics: Incident of Ubaidah destroying his written books at death

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by al-Nu'man ibn Qais: The old women of the tribe, when the muezzin would begin the iqama, would say: This is the prayer of Ubaidah, because of his speed.

chainIssues: Good chain with reliable narrators
al-Nu'man ibn Qais uses indirect transmission term (عَنْ) but is a reliable narrator and likely witnessed this

potential_issues.issue: al-Nu'man ibn Qais uses indirect transmission (عَنْ) regarding the old women's statement
potential_issues.impact: Introduces slight ambiguity, but al-Nu'man is reliable and this is a common practice, especially for attesting to the recognition of someone's characteristic (Ubaidah's swift prayer)

Topics: Ubaidah's characteristic of swift prayer

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Muhammad ibn Sireen: A group of people came to Ubaidah disputing to ask him to reconcile between them. He said: I will not speak until you appoint me as a ruler. It was as if he believed that the ruler has in this matter something that the judge and others do not have.

narrators.name: Abd al-Wahid ibn Ziyad
reliabilityIssues: Reported to be weak in hadith transmission

chainIssues: Abd al-Wahid ibn Ziyad is graded as Saduq (weak), affecting chain reliability
Uses direct transmission terms (أَخْبَرَنَا/حَدَّثَنَا) from Ahmad to Asim, which is positive
However, Muhammad ibn Sireen uses indirect transmission (عَنْ) from Asim

potential_issues.issue: Abd al-Wahid ibn Ziyad is graded as Saduq (weak narrator)
potential_issues.impact: The presence of a weak narrator in the chain significantly impacts reliability, downgrading from Sound to Acceptable category

potential_issues.issue: Muhammad ibn Sireen uses indirect transmission (عَنْ) from Asim
potential_issues.impact: Creates ambiguity about the directness of connection, though Muhammad ibn Sireen is highly reliable

Topics: Ubaidah's refusal to judge disputes without being appointed as a ruler

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Muhammad ibn Abdullah al-Ansari: Two boys came to him with writing tablets in them, disputing. He said: It is a ruling, and he refused.

narrators.name: Muhammad ibn Abdullah al-Ansari
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Abdullah ibn Abd al-Rahman al-Ansari

narrators.name: Hisham
narrators.full_name: Hisham ibn Urwah ibn al-Zubayr al-Asadi
reliabilityIssues: Known for making mistakes (yukhti'), especially in his latter years

chainIssues: Hisham ibn Urwah is graded as Thiqah Yukhti' (makes mistakes)
Multiple indirect transmission terms (عَنْ) used by both Muhammad and Ubaidah in the narration
The chain has a large gap between generations (Sixth generation to Companion)

potential_issues.issue: Hisham ibn Urwah is graded as Thiqah Yukhti' (reliable but makes mistakes)
potential_issues.impact: Known for errors in transmission, particularly in his later life, which affects the overall reliability of the chain

potential_issues.issue: Both Muhammad and the connection to Ubaidah use indirect transmission (عَنْ)
potential_issues.impact: Multiple indirect links create cumulative ambiguity about the directness of connections

Topics: Incident of two boys disputing through written tablets presented to Ubaidah

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Muhammad: I asked Ubaidah about a verse. He said: Upon you is to fear Allah, and to be guided rightly. For those who used to know about what the Quran was revealed have passed away.

narrators.name: Muhammad ibn Abdullah
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Abdullah ibn Abd al-Rahman al-Ansari

chainIssues: Good chain with mostly direct transmission terms (أَخْبَرَنَا) from the collector through Ibn Awn
Only Muhammad ibn Sireen uses indirect transmission (عَنْ), but he is a highly reliable narrator

potential_issues.issue: Muhammad ibn Sireen uses indirect transmission (عَنْ) from Ubaidah
potential_issues.impact: While this introduces slight ambiguity, Muhammad ibn Sireen is a highly reliable narrator of the third generation who likely heard directly from Ubaidah, so the impact is minimal

Topics: Dialogue between Muhammad and Ubaidah regarding interpretation of a Quranic verse

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Ubaidah: People differed from me regarding beverages. I have not had any drink for thirty years except honey, milk, and water.

narrators.name: Hisham
narrators.full_name: Hisham ibn Urwah ibn al-Zubayr al-Asadi
reliabilityIssues: Known for making mistakes (yukhti'), especially in latter years

chainIssues: Hisham ibn Urwah is Thiqah Yukhti' (makes mistakes)
Multiple indirect transmission terms (عَنْ) in the chain
Hisham's errors in later life may affect reliability

potential_issues.issue: Hisham ibn Urwah is graded as Thiqah Yukhti' (reliable but makes mistakes)
potential_issues.impact: Known for errors particularly in his latter years, affecting overall chain reliability

potential_issues.issue: Multiple uses of indirect transmission (عَنْ) in succession
potential_issues.impact: Creates cumulative ambiguity about directness of connections despite narrators being generally reliable

Topics: Ubaidah's ascetic practice regarding beverages

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Muhammad: I asked Ubaidah about fermented drink. He said: People have introduced new drinks, so I have not had any drink for twenty years except water, milk, and honey.

chainIssues: All narrators are reliable (Thiqah/Thiqah Thabt)
Uses direct transmission terms (أَخْبَرَنَا/حَدَّثَنَا) in early chain
Multiple indirect transmission terms (عَنْ) from Ayyub and Muhammad onwards

potential_issues.issue: Multiple indirect transmission terms (عَنْ) from Ayyub onwards
potential_issues.impact: Creates some ambiguity, but all narrators are highly reliable, so the impact is minimal

Topics: Ubaidah's ascetic practice regarding fermented beverages

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Muhammad: I said to Ubaidah: We have some of the hair of the Messenger of Allah ﷺ with us, from the family of Anas. Ubaidah said: I would prefer to have a single hair of his more than all the gold and silver on the face of the earth.

narrators.name: Muhammad ibn Abdullah al-Ansari
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Abdullah ibn Abd al-Rahman al-Ansari

chainIssues: Strong chain with all reliable narrators (Thiqah/Thiqah Thabt)
Uses direct transmission terms (أَخْبَرَنَا/حَدَّثَنَا) in the beginning
Only Muhammad uses indirect transmission (عَنْ), who is highly reliable

potential_issues.issue: Muhammad ibn Sireen uses indirect transmission (عَنْ) from Ubaidah
potential_issues.impact: While this introduces slight ambiguity, Muhammad ibn Sireen is a highly reliable narrator of the third generation who likely heard directly from Ubaidah

Topics: Ubaidah's reverence for the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ and his relics

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by al-Nu'man's father: I said to Ubaidah: I have heard that you will die and then return before the Day of Judgment carrying a banner. A victory will be opened for you that was not opened for anyone before you, nor will it be opened for anyone after you. Ubaidah said: If Allah keeps me alive twice and causes me to die twice before the Day of Judgment, it would not be good for me.

narrators.name: Abd al-Wahid ibn Ziyad
reliabilityIssues: Reported to be weak in hadith transmission

chainIssues: Abd al-Wahid ibn Ziyad is graded as Saduq (weak), affecting chain reliability
Qais ibn al-Nu'man (the father) is of unknown reliability status (Majhul al-Hal)
Presence of two problematic narrators in the chain

potential_issues.issue: Abd al-Wahid ibn Ziyad is graded as Saduq (weak narrator)
potential_issues.impact: The presence of a weak narrator significantly impacts reliability

potential_issues.issue: Qais ibn al-Nu'man (the father) has unknown reliability status (Majhul al-Hal)
potential_issues.impact: Unknown reliability of this narrator further weakens the chain

Topics: Ubaidah's response to prophecies about his resurrection

hadiths.english_translation: It was reported that Ubaidah willed that al-Aswad ibn Yazid should pray the funeral prayer over him.

narrators.name: Mis'ar
reliabilityIssues: Graded as Saduq, not of highest reliability

narrators.name: Abu Hasin
narrators.full_name: Khalid ibn Abi Khalid al-Wali al-Kufi

chainIssues: Chain is maqtu' (cut off before reaching a companion)
Mis'ar ibn Kidam is graded as Saduq (weak)
Abu Hasin is graded as Saduq (weak)
Multiple indirect transmission terms (عَنْ) with weak narrators

potential_issues.issue: Chain is maqtu' (cut) at the companion level
potential_issues.impact: Chain is disconnected at Ubaidah's statement

potential_issues.issue: Both Mis'ar ibn Kidam and Abu Hasin are graded as Saduq (weak)
potential_issues.impact: Multiple weak narrators in the chain significantly affect reliability

hadiths.IISGrade: Disconnections But All Narrators Are Ok
Topics: Ubaidah's will regarding funeral arrangements

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abu Hasin: Ubaidah al-Salmani willed that al-Aswad ibn Yazid should pray the funeral prayer over him. Al-Aswad said: Hasten with him before the liar comes (meaning al-Mukhtar). He prayed the funeral prayer over him before sunset. Ubaidah died in the year 72 (AH).

narrators.name: Shu'bah
narrators.full_name: Shu'bah ibn al-Hajjaj ibn al-Ward al-Ataki

narrators.name: Abu Hasin
narrators.full_name: Khalid ibn Abi Khalid al-Wali al-Kufi

chainIssues: Strong chain from Sulaiman to Shu'bah (both Thiqah Thabt)
Abu Hasin is graded as Saduq, weakening the chain
Uses indirect transmission (عَنْ) with a Saduq narrator
However, the information comes from al-Aswad, a Thiqah narrator, which adds credibility

potential_issues.issue: Abu Hasin is graded as Saduq (weak narrator) and uses indirect transmission (عَنْ)
potential_issues.impact: This weakens the chain somewhat, though the informant (al-Aswad) is reliable

Topics: Incident of Ubaidah's funeral and death in year 72 AH

hadiths.english_translation: His name is Shaqiq ibn Salamah al-Asadi, from Banu Malik ibn Malik ibn Tha'labah ibn Dudan ibn Asad ibn Khuzaimah.

chainIssues: This is a biographical note without a complete hadith chain

potential_issues.issue: This entry is primarily biographical, not a complete hadith
potential_issues.impact: No transmission chain present

Topics: Biographical information on Shaqiq ibn Salamah

hadiths.english_translation: I said to Abu Wail: Did you see the Messenger of Allah ﷺ? He said: Yes, and I was a beardless young man, but I did not see him (with my own eyes).

chainIssues: Abu al-Anbas uses indirect transmission (عَنْ) but is reliable
Good chain overall with direct terms from Waki'

potential_issues.issue: Abu al-Anbas uses indirect transmission (عَنْ) from Abu Wail
potential_issues.impact: Creates slight ambiguity, but Abu al-Anbas is reliable

Topics: Abu Wail's statement about seeing the Messenger of Allah ﷺ

hadiths.english_translation: Shaqiq said: A letter came to us from Abu Bakr while we were at al-Qadisiyyah, and Abdullah ibn al-Arqam wrote it.

chainIssues: al-Aʿmash is known as a mudallis (type 2, generally reliable)
Shaqiq uses indirect term (عَنْ)

potential_issues.issue: al-Aʿmash is known as a mudallis (category 2), though he is generally reliable
potential_issues.impact: While this introduces some concern, al-Aʿmash's mudallis practice is not of the most problematic category

Topics: Historical letter from Abu Bakr during the Battle of al-Qadisiyyah

hadiths.english_translation: Shaqiq said: A letter came to us from Abu Bakr while we were at al-Qadisiyyah, and Abdullah ibn al-Arqam wrote it for him.

chainIssues: al-Aʿmash is mudallis (type 2) using indirect term (عَنِ)
Shaqiq also uses indirect transmission (عَنْ)

potential_issues.issue: al-Aʿmash (mudallis category 2) uses indirect transmission (عَنِ)
potential_issues.impact: While al-Aʿmash is reliable, his mudallis practice with indirect terms creates some ambiguity about direct hearing

Topics: Historical letter from Abu Bakr during military campaign

hadiths.english_translation: A letter came to us from the Commander of the Believers while we were at al-Qadisiyyah.

chainIssues: al-Mughirah is graded as Saduq
Chain uses direct transmission terms from first three narrators

potential_issues.issue: al-Mughirah ibn Miqsam is graded as Saduq (weak)
potential_issues.impact: Presence of a weak narrator in the chain reduces overall reliability

Topics: Historical letter from the Commander of the Believers

hadiths.english_translation: The letter came to us from the Commander of the Believers while we were at al-Qadisiyyah.

chainIssues: Good chain from Waki' to al-Aʿmash using direct transmission terms
al-Aʿmash is a mudallis (type 2) but generally reliable

potential_issues.issue: al-Aʿmash is a mudallis (category 2), though he uses direct transmission term (حَدَّثَنَا)
potential_issues.impact: While al-Aʿmash is reliable, his mudallis classification requires attention; however direct transmission term mitigates this

Topics: Historical letter during the Battle of al-Qadisiyyah
